intro: Astragalus ackermanii, commonly known as Ackerman's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in mountainous regions and has a limited geographic range. Astragalus ackermanii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
